title: WA MUN team competes at Utah conference
title_page: WA MUN team competes at Utah conference
maintext:
MT. PLEASANT — Wasatch Academy (WA) Model United Nations (MUN) team of 18 delegates recently competed at the Utah High School State MUN Conference at the University of Utah, Salt Lake City. Eight members of the team earned awards.
During the competition, the team represented Mali and Kenya (two team members are from those countries) as well as Belgium, for Historical Security Council 1948.
In the single-day competition, Lavi Tuineau and Emanuel Garcia Flores received an excellence award on the Historical Security Council (Belgium), and Giulia Stocchino and Albe Ward received an excellence award on the Disarmament and International Security Committee (Kenya);
Roki Diop earned an excellence award on the Economic and Financial Committee (Mali); Angelica Varillas and Assetou Diop worked hard to earn a superior award in the Social, Humanitarian, and Culture Committee (Mali); and Jacopo Warnking pushed himself to take home a superior award in the General Assembly (Kenya).
